Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2009 06:59PM Jadai wrote: I love reading these posts.  As some of you know, my mom was diagnosed with stage IV IBC with mets to bone.  The chemo is kicking butt and my mom, who had excruciating back pain supposedly from the mets, doesn't have it anymore.  Her oncologist is thrilled with her response and talking surgery soon and chemo number 5 is in two weeks.  What really bothers me still is that her original onc. was gloom and doom from the start.  I am so happy for you!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Posts.Title: good news! MissyBraddy getwell

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2008 06:05PM Jadai wrote: Your mom doesn't have an expiration date!  You need to find another Dr. and someone who has dealt with this.  My mom has stage IV IBC (mets to the bone) which isn't curable but is very treatable.  Her first Dr. was the same way.  She was gloom and doom from the get go.  After one appointment I waited for my mom to leave and then went back in to her office to confront her about her poor attitude.  Anyway, that was her LAST appointment with that Dr.  We now have a confident, competent Dr. that is just fantastic.  It is so important to be comfortable with your Dr.!

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2011 08:22PM Jadai wrote: Amber was the first person to contact me when I came here so afraid after my mom's IBC diagnosis.  These pictures just made me cry as I still think of Amber often.  They are so beautiful but they make me so sad and so angry.  Her little girls remind me of my and my sister....one blonde and one brunette :)  I will try and remain grateful that I had my mom as long as I did.  I think these pictures will serve as a wonderful reminder of their mother's love to these beautiful children.
Posts.Title: Amber's (Mrs_X_Sunneedazee) daughters photos Joanne58 cookie97

Posts.Content: Dec 24, 2008 08:17PM Jadai wrote: Hi, My mom is also stage IV with bone mets and she does taxotere/cytoxan every three weeks and herceptin weekly.  She is also having surgery pretty soon, probably after 2 more chemotherapy treatments, she has done 3 as of Monday.  Her breast was so bad and after just 2 treatments the response is tremendous and her oncologist is thrilled with the results.  This chemo is really doing it's job.  Her case is even rarer in that she was diagnosed with leukemia at the same time so although they are pretty sure it has metastisized they cannot be 100% positive.  So, you are not alone, my mom is undergoing the same type of treatment.
Posts.Title: Don't know what to do lovinmomma saint

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2009 04:13AM Jadai wrote: Her Dr. let her stay another day which is fantastic.  I went for dinner and stayed for a few hours tonight and he is really doing well.....only taking 2 pain pills per day!!!  She is eating very well and up and around.  Thanks encoremom for writing, it seems she is having the same experience as you, thank god!  We were laughing earlier that her cataract surgery was much worse!
Posts.Title: Nervous...Mom Having Surgery Tomorrow Jadai Jadai

Posts.Content: Jadai wrote: Hi Everyone, I have pretty much been posting here since my mom was diagnosed with metastatic IBC (IBC to bone).  She was doing great until two days before her birthday in April when she was diagnosed with brain mets.  She has been through the ringer ladies.  She is now in a nursing facility, which eats away at me every day, and unable to walk or pretty much feel the lower half of her body.  I won't go in to all of the detail but I am just asking that you all pray for her and keep her in your thoughts as she fights the fight.  Thanks! Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2009 08:15PM Jadai wrote: Oh Amber, you have been so inspiring and you were so kind enough to help me through my mom's IBC diagnosis.  I cannot relate to your situation but I know there are times in life when, in one way or another we feel that way, like we have had enough.  It happens and then the next day there is clarity and new hope.  Your feelings are true and raw and it is ok to have every one of them.  I have been thinking about what to write and I think you need to do what is best for you and what truly feels right in your heart.  It's the best any of us can do.  <<<<HUGS>>>>
